Class ec.ezlib.prim.Promise 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.prim.Promise
public class Promise
extends Object
implements Sendable
A kind of Sendable that's born DEFERRED, does not initially designate an object, but has a corresponding Resolver for determining what it does desgnate, or alternatively, with what problem it is BROKEN.

Promise()
reasonable defaults
Promise(Class)
If 'optType' is non-null, the resulting promise should only be:

1) sent messages acceptable by this type (though this will not be checked before delivery),

2) forwarded to objects that are of this type (though this is not yet checked), or

3) forwarded to promises whose types are a subtype of this type (though this is not yet checked).

call(String, Object[])
ignore()
optProblem()
resolution()
run()
For EZ-style multi-object construction
sendAll(String, Object[])
sendAllOnly(String, Object[])
state()
One of "DEFERRED", "KEPT", or "BROKEN".
takeResolver()
Tear-off style for delivering multiple facets of an object securely
toString()
Returns a string representation of the object.

Promise 
 public Promise(Class optType)
If 'optType' is non-null, the resulting promise should only be:

1) sent messages acceptable by this type (though this will not be checked before delivery),

2) forwarded to objects that are of this type (though this is not yet checked), or

3) forwarded to promises whose types are a subtype of this type (though this is not yet checked).

Promise 
 public Promise()
reasonable defaults

state 
 public String state()
One of "DEFERRED", "KEPT", or "BROKEN". May not return "UNRESOLVED" or "FORWARDED".

Shortens forwarding chains into a canonical state and returns the external notion of my state.

toString 
 public String toString()
Returns a string representation of the object.
